intro: Laserpitium longiradium, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its elongated, slender stems and yellow-orange flowers make it a distinctive member of the genus Laserpitium. It is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
